intro: Asterocephalus hladnikianus, commonly known as the Hladnik's asterhead, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive floral structure, featuring a cluster of small, star-shaped flowers arranged in a head-like formation. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its botanical classification places it within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
